message: I'm offering you a product for $100. I want to assure you that I'm not trying to scam you, and I'm willing to provide you with information to help you make an informed decision. If you buy this product, you'll get to keep it, and I'll move on to the next one. If you don't buy it, I'll tell you the quality of the product, and we can move on to the next one. What do you say?
I'd like to pass on this product and get the information about its quality. I'm not ready to make a decision yet.

I'm glad you decided to pass on the previous product. Now, I'd like to offer you this new product for $100. I've had a chance to inspect it, and I can confidently say that it's a high-quality product. I'm willing to provide you with a 30-day warranty on this product, and I'll also give you a 10% discount on any future purchases if you buy this one. What do you say?
I appreciate the warranty and discount offer, but I'm not convinced by your claim that the product is high-quality. I'd like to see the product's quality revealed before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, and I don't blame you for wanting to verify the product's quality. Let me offer you a compromise: I'll reveal the quality of this product to you, and you can decide whether to buy it or not. If you do decide to buy it, I'll give you a 20% discount on the price, making it $80. If you don't buy it, I'll reveal the quality and we can move on to the next product. What do you say?
I'll take the product at the discounted price of $80. I'm willing to take the risk and hope it's high-quality.

Great decision on the previous product! I'm glad you took the risk and it paid off. Now, let's move on to this new product. I want to offer you a different approach this time. I'll tell you the quality of this product, and you can decide whether to buy it at the full price of $100. If you do buy it, I'll give you a'verified high-quality' badge, which means that if you're not satisfied with the product, we can revisit the price in the next round. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the'verified high-quality' badge. I'd rather buy a product at a discount, and I'm not willing to pay full price for a product without knowing its quality.

I understand your preference for discounts. Let me offer you a deal on this low-quality product. I'll give you a 50% discount, making it $50, and I'll throw in a free accessory that's worth $20. This way, you'll get a good deal on a product that's still worth something, even if it's not high-quality. Plus, you'll be helping me clear out some inventory, which will increase the chances of getting a high-quality product in the next round. What do you say?

I appreciate the discount and the free accessory, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product and pay full price for it.

I respect your decision to wait for a high-quality product. In that case, I'll make you a deal on this low-quality product that's a bit different. I'll give you the product for $100, but I'll also include a 'get out of one free' pass, which means that if you buy this product and the next product is high-quality, you can return this one and get a full refund. This way, you'll have a chance to get a high-quality product and still get a product out of this round. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the 'get out of one free' pass. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product and not have to worry about getting a refund.
